business.headline: What is the 10-30-50 formula? Edelweiss MF's Radhika Gupta on smart money habitsRadhika Gupta explained that this tug of war between splurging and saving is not new. In fact, she advised a simple rule for different life stages, i.e., the 10-30-50 principle.

Fitch retains its rating for India, sees growth at 6.5%Fitch's rating comes days after S&P Global Ratings lifted its sovereign credit rating on India, citing strong economic growth, marking its first upgrade in 18 years.
Sensex ends 329 points higher, Nifty above 24.950; Infosys gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 329.06 points to close at 81,635.91, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 97.65 points to end at 24,967.75.

Are wedding gifts really tax-free? Here's the answerIn India, weddings are full of joy, rituals and generous gifts. But when the celebrations end, many couples wonder, do these gifts come with hidden tax bills? The answer may surprise you.

PMO to convene big meeting tomorrow as US tariffs set to come into force: SourcesThe Prime Minister's Office will hold a high-level review meeting on August 26 to assess support measures for Indian exporters hit by higher US tariffs. The session, chaired by the PM's Principal Secretary, comes as Washington doubles duties, with Indian goods now facing a steep 50% tariff, raising cost pressures on exporters.

Why hospitals have barred cashless services from Bajaj Allianz policyholdersThe meeting between AHPI's (Association of Healthcare Providers India) will include core committee members and senior representatives from Bajaj Allianz, and is scheduled for August 28.
Zerodha's Nithin Kamath on the one skill AI can't replaceNithin Kamath explained that curiosity should not be confined to a person's own role but should extend to the larger environment around them.

Big PMO meet tomorrow as Trump's 50% tariffs set to come into force: SourcesStarting Wednesday, Indian goods entering the US market will be subject to a 50% tariff after Washington doubled existing duties, heightening cost pressures on exporters.

Common empanelment explained: Why big private hospitals and insurers are at oddsCommon empanelment aims to simplify cashless insurance in India, but hospitals resist over tariffs and operational issues, leaving policyholders' access dependent on achieving fair rates, efficient settlements, and system flexibility.

Will ITR filing deadline be extended again after delayed rollout of utilities?With the revised ITR utilities coming out much later than expected, taxpayers and professionals are now questioning whether the government will grant another extension to ease the compliance burden.

Mangal Electrical IPO allotment out: Check your status, possible listing gainsInvestors who applied for the Mangal Electrical IPO can check their allotment status through two official platforms, the BSE website and the IPO registrar, Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd.

Online gaming law: Will users get Dream11, MPL, Winzo wallet cash?The Online Gaming Bill, cleared by both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha this week, bans all forms of online money games. These are defined as games where players deposit money, directly or indirectly, with the hope of winning cash rewards.

entertainment.headline: Sanjay Dutt's daughter Trishala's cryptic post: Family not free pass to mistreatActor Sanjay Dutt's daughter Trishala Dutt opened up about manipulative family dynamics by sharing a cryptic note. She urged prioritising mental health over preserving family image.

American comedian Reginald Carroll shot dead in Mississippi shootingStand-up comedian Reggie Carroll died after a shooting incident in Mississippi, United States. His death has shocked the comedy community and led to a police investigation.

Avneet Kaur reacts to Virat Kohli liking her Insta post: Let the love keep comingAvneet Kaur addressed the social media controversy involving Virat Kohli. At the trailer launch of her film 'Love in Vietnam', she reacted to the incident, saying "let the love come".

All about Armaan Malik's first stadium tour bringing global pop vision homeArmaan Malik prepares for his first-ever stadium show in Mumbai, culminating a multi-city tour that celebrates his evolution from Bollywood playback singer to global pop artist.

Kumail Nanjiani says he signed 6 MCU films, turned to therapy after Eternals failedKumail Nanjiani reveals how the poor reception of Marvel's Eternals deeply affected him. He sought therapy to cope with the unexpected career and personal challenges that followed.

Vidya Balan calls Parineeta her dream debut as it returns to cinemas after 20 yearsVidya Balan's debut film 'Parineeta' will be re-released on its 20th anniversary. Ahead of that, the actor called it her "dream debut".

BTS' Jin returns to South Korea to host manager Kim Taehyung's weddingBTS member Jin is back in South Korea to host the wedding of a close manager. Just a day earlier, he was seen in the audience at his juniors' concert, TOMORROW X TOGETHER.

Soha Ali Khan launches podcast on women's wellness and ageingSoha Ali Khan has launched a wellness podcast called 'All About Her' focusing on women's insecurities and ageing. The show aims to create a safe, unfiltered space for conversations on wellness and self-kindness.

Kartik Aaryan sets on a non-stop 48-hour shoot marathon after returning from LondonActor Kartik Aaryan returned to Mumbai after a relaxing London holiday. He updated about his intense 48-hour shoot marathon on social media.

Vishal Malhotra on Ishq Vishk mania: Fans scratched us, I still bear the markActor Vishal Malhotra fondly recalled the memorable release day of 'Ishq Vishk', highlighting both the film's success and the overwhelming fan frenzy that left him physically marked. The film hit theatres in 2003.

How Demon Slayer conquered pop culture in record timeIn this week's Animania we will discover how 'Demon Slayer' went from Japanese comic to global pop culture juggernaut, breaking sales and box office records with its story, art, and emotional pull.

Shriya Pilgaonkar joins Akshay, Saif in Priyadarshan's thriller Haiwaan. ReportsActor Shriya Pilgaonkar has joined director Priyadarshan's upcoming thriller Haiwaan. The film is a Hindi remake of the Malayalam hit 'Oppam' and marks a major reunion of actors Akshay Kumar and Saif Ali Khan.
Britney Spears' fans concerned after she shares nude photo with cryptic postPop star Britney Spears' latest nude Instagram post has set the internet abuzz. Fans are concerned about her well-being.

Walking Dead actor Norman Reedus' son Mingus pleads not guilty to assault chargesMingus Reedus, the son of 'The Walking Dead' actor Norman Reedus and supermodel Helena Christensen, has pleaded not guilty to a series of misdemeanour charges in Manhattan.

Singer Karan Aujla recalls surviving six gun attacks in Canada, calls Punjab safestPunjabi singer-rapper Karan Aujla opened up about surviving multiple gunfire attacks in Canada and the criticism he faced for moving to Dubai. He explained why choosing his family's safety over public perception was the only decision he could make.

Rise & Fall trailer: Dhanashree talks about broken trust on Ashneer Grover showHosted by entrepreneur Ashneer Grover, the trailer for 'Rise & Fall', was released on Monday. It gave a glimpse into the show, featuring 16 celebrity contestants, including Arjun Bijlani, Dhanashree Verma, Kiku Sharda and Kubbra Sait.

No grudges: Ashish Vidyarthi says Apoorva Mukhija apologised after The TraitorsActor Ashish Vidyarthi denied being on bad terms with influencer Apoorva Mukhija after 'The Traitors'. He said the Rebel Kid apologised for disrespectfully talking about him on the show. Vidyarthi also said that he advised Mukhija to carve her own path.

Rakesh Roshan shares it took six months to design Hrithik's iconic Krrish maskDirector Rakesh Roshan shared that it took six months to design actor Hrithik Roshan's iconic Krrish mask, which was made of wax and required special care as it melted within hours.

Farah Khan attends Ganga Aarti in Rishikesh, shares video from her spiritual visitFarah Khan attended the Ganga Aarti in Rishikesh for the first time, calling it a beautiful and divine experience blessed with rain. She also announced YouTube FanFest 2025, which will feature over 20 creators and artists across comedy, music, dance, gaming, and more.

general news.headline: We'll find way out despite pressure: PM stays firm ahead of 50% US tariff deadlinePrime Minister Narendra Modi, while addressing the public in Ahmedabad, said that India will stand firm no matter how much pressure comes. This was in response to the US tariff of 50% which is effective tomorrow.

Possibility of misuse doesn't nullify bill to oust criminal leaders: Mukul RohatgiSenior lawyer Mukul Rohatgi said the new bill allowing the 30-day detention of ministers is a necessary step to cleanse politics, dismissing opposition claims of draconian intent or potential misuse.

PM Modi's degree personal info: Court cancels panel's order to disclose detailsThe Delhi High Court set aside the Central Information Commissioner's 2016 order and ruled that Delhi University need not disclose details of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 1978 graduation degree.

BJP shares Congress poll data to take on Rahul Gandhi's 'vote chori' chargeThe BJP countered Congress's 'vote chori' charge, with Amit Malviya stating that the Congress and its allies secured its highest vote share in 35 years in the 2024 elections.

Astro Not, Anurag Thakur! Lord Hanuman's Legendary Leap isn't LiteralBJP MP Anurag Thakur quizzed school kids about the first astronaut. He corrected their Neil Armstrong, not with Yuri Gagarin, but with a divine detour, "Hanuman ji". This common error happens because of a textual understanding of the scriptures. Lord Hanuman's legendary leap is a metaphor for devotion and strength, and not meant to be a manual for the moon mission.
Top court sets up special team to probe affairs of VantaraSupreme Court forms SIT headed by ex-judge Justice J Chelameswar to probe affairs of Vantara animal shelter

Teacher sets fire to herself, daughter, 3, both die; family allege dowry harassmentA government school teacher burnt herself and her 3-year-old daughter alive in their Jodhpur home. The child died on the spot while the woman succumbed to her injuries in the hospital.

Voter Adhikar Yatra: 'BJP's vote chori, dubious 'double engine' has riled Bihar'Q&A with CPI(ML) Liberation general secretary Dipankar Bhattacharya on the impact of Rahul Gandhi's Voter Adhikar Yatra and Prashant Kishor's prospects in the Bihar assembly polls

When women die, we scroll: India's outrage gap on gendered violenceViolence against women is not accidental or spontaneous; it is structural, patterned, and legitimised through custom, silence, and legal delay. It is no longer perceived as a rupture but as routine, an unending cycle that reveals a society deeply invested in disciplining, diminishing, and discarding women.

Framed in false case, ran government from jail: Arvind Kejriwal jabs Amit ShahArvind Kejriwal hit back at Amit Shah's remarks on AAP running the Delhi government from jail, calling the case against him a political conspiracy and accusing the BJP of shielding criminals while targeting opponents with false charges.

Elon Musk's xAI sues Apple and OpenAI over artificial intelligence competitionApple and OpenAI have "locked up markets to maintain their monopolies and prevent innovators like X and xAI from competing," the lawsuit filed by Elon Musk's artificial intelligence startup xAI said.

India warns Pak over J&K floods in rare goodwill gesture amid Indus treaty freezeThe communication was made by the Indian High Commission in Islamabad on Sunday to the Pakistani Foreign Ministry on the matter. This is the first time that an information regarding such a matter has been sent via the High Commission.

CBSE vs ICSE: Why are there fewer ICSE schools despite its strong reputation?ICSE schools remain fewer but are highly valued for their rigorous syllabus and strong English foundations. This exclusivity highlights quality education focused on holistic learning rather than mass expansion.

Married woman, 20, killed by lover with explosive powder stick in Karnataka lodgeA 20-year-old married woman was murdered by her lover in a Mysuru lodge after a quarrel. The accused allegedly killed her using an explosive powder stick before being caught by locals.

Will US deport Green Card, visa holders using old drunk-driving cases?A new US bill could make a single drink and drive case, even from years ago, the grounds for deportation or entry denial for Green Card and visa holders. Immigrant communities and experts fear it could bypass due process and disproportionately affect legal residents. The bill could affect lakhs of Indians working or studying in the US.

Why hospitals have barred cashless services from Bajaj Allianz policyholdersThe meeting between AHPI's (Association of Healthcare Providers India) will include core committee members and senior representatives from Bajaj Allianz, and is scheduled for August 28.

Parineeti Chopra, Raghav Chadha announce pregnancy: Blessed beyond measureParineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha are going to welcome their first child soon. The couple announced the news on social media.

Will Sergio Gor open DC doors for Delhi or give India Trump's jolt?Donald Trump's nomination of Sergio Gor as ambassador to India offers New Delhi a rare direct line to the US President, given his access and proximity. Yet Gor's lack of diplomatic experience, unclear stance on tariffs and India-Pakistan ties, and overlapping role as Special Envoy create uncertainties. What does it mean for India?

Why monkey-barring, the toxic dating trend, hurts more than a breakupMonkey-barring is the latest dating trend experts are calling toxic. It's less about love and more about fear and insecurity. Here's how to spot if your partner is already eyeing the next branch before letting go of you.

How India's forex reserve rebound is a march towards stability in money marketsFrom record highs to sharp declines and a resilient rebound, India's foreign exchange reserves tell a story of strategic economic shifts and robust domestic drivers

Valiant Lakshya Sen bows out in first round in heartbreaking return to ParisBWF World Championships 2025: Former bronze medallist Lakshya Sen fought hard in the opening round, but China's top seed Shi Yuqi proved too strong. It marked Lakshya's ninth first-round exit of the year.

Rajasthan bans meat and egg on August 28, September 6 due to religious festivalsIn a first, the sale of eggs has also been banned for two days throughout the state on these two days. According to sources, the decision to ban the sale of meat and eggs was taken due to the demands of religious organisations.

Sachin Tendulkar cracks Steve Bucknor, Aadhaar card jokes in hilarious Reddit AMASachin Tendulkar delighted fans in a witty Reddit AMA, mixing personal anecdotes with cricketing tales. From a playful dig at umpire Steve Bucknor to confirming son Arjun's engagement, the batting legend was candid and insightful.

sports.headline: US Open: Petra Kvitova bids farewell to tennis after first round defeatPetra Kvitova bid an emotional farewell after a first-round US Open exit, closing a stellar career with 31 WTA titles and two Wimbledon crowns. Meanwhile, Krejcikova advanced, overpowering Victoria Mboko 6-3, 6-2 in the opening round.

Neeraj Chopra's opponents for Zurich Diamond League Final revealedNeeraj Chopra heads into the Zurich Diamond League Final on August 28, aiming to conquer top global javelin throwers. With a stellar season behind him, he eyes victory and momentum ahead of Tokyo World Championship 2025.

Sachin Tendulkar confirms son Arjun's engagement, reveals advice to daughter SaraSachin Tendulkar has confirmed that his son, Arjun Tendulkar, is engaged to Saaniya Chandok in a private ceremony. Saaniya hails from a prominent Mumbai business family, known for their ventures in hospitality and food.

Sachin Tendulkar cracks Steve Bucknor, Aadhaar card jokes in hilarious Reddit AMASachin Tendulkar delighted fans in a witty Reddit AMA, mixing personal anecdotes with cricketing tales. From a playful dig at umpire Steve Bucknor to confirming son Arjun's engagement, the batting legend was candid and insightful.

Khalid Jamil leaves door open for Chhetri's India return: He is a legendSunil Chhetri's absence from India's CAFA Cup squad sparked debates, but coach Khalid Jamil confirmed the striker remains vital for the national team. Fans eagerly await his potential return for the October Asian Cup qualifiers.

Spouses of deceased Indian Cricketers' Association members to get Rs 1 lakh from BCCIThe Indian Cricketers' Association has launched a new welfare scheme providing Rs 1 lakh to spouses of deceased members. This initiative aims to extend meaningful support to families and will be reviewed alongside potential BCCI pension plans.

From Ahmedabad to Adelaide: Top 5 knocks of Pujara in Test cricketCheteshwar Pujara, India's resilient No. 3, retired from all forms of Indian cricket on August 24, bringing the curtain down on a 15-year career that saw him score 7,195 runs in 103 Tests with unmatched grit and patience.

Who is Hridaya Jain? Karnataka boy who signed for Slovenia's 2nd division clubAt just 19, Hridaya Jain's move to Slovenia's NK Brinje Grosuplje offers Indian football fresh hope. From winning I-League Emerging Player honors with Delhi FC to chasing a European dream, the Karnataka teenager carries the promise of a new generation.

Day 2 LIVE: Jack Draper and Madison Keys in action, Kvitova crashes outUS Open 2025 Day 2 Live Updates: Home stars Jack Draper and Madison Keys are in action on Day 2 of the US Open. Earlier in the day, Barbora Krejcikova advanced to the second round after beating Victoria Mboko, while Petra Kvitova bid farewell to tennis after her first round loss to Diane Parry.

Rafael Nadal's sister elated after Alexandra Eala's historic triumphRafael Nadal's sister Maribel congratulated Alexandra Eala, who scripted history at the US Open by becoming the first Filipino in the Open Era to win a Grand Slam main-draw match, defeating 14th seed Clara Tauson.

India confident of clinching Asia Cup hockey crown and World Cup berthIndia, led by coach Craig Fulton and captain Harmanpreet Singh, exude confidence ahead of the Asia Cup. Yet, the team insists no opponent will be taken lightly as they chase their first title since 2017.

Yashavsi Jaiswal will get his chance in Indian T20I team soon: Farveez MaharoofFormer Sri Lanka all-rounder Farveez Maharoof revealed his admiration for Yashasvi Jaiswal and said that it's just a matter of time before he makes it to the Indian T20I squad. He also explained the reasons behind Jasprit Bumrah's constant struggles with injuries.

Mirabai Chanu returns to action in style with gold in Commonwealth ChampionshipsMirabai Chanu made a strong comeback by winning gold at the Commonwealth Championships in Ahmedabad. Her record-breaking performance sets high expectations for upcoming World Championships and Asian Games.

Asia Cup 2025: Harshit Rana sharpens skills in Delhi Premier leagueIndia fast bowler Harshit Rana is sharpening his skills in the Delhi Premier League 2025 (DPL 2025) ahead of the Asia Cup set to begin on September 9.

Nadal Academy star rejoices historic win with unreal comeback vs Clara TausonAlexandra Eala made history at the 2025 US Open, becoming the first Filipino in the Open Era to win a Grand Slam main-draw match. The 19-year-old stunned 14th seed Clara Tauson with a thrilling 6-3, 2-6, 7-6 comeback victory.

Khalid Jamil unveils first India squad for CAFA Cup: No Mohun Bagan playersKhalid Jamil's first India squad for the CAFA Nations Cup omits Mohun Bagan Super Giant players after the club refused to release them. Gurpreet Singh Sandhu returns as East Bengal players headline the 23-man list.

Who is Francesca Jones? British player with 8 fingers, 7 toes set for debutFrancesca Jones, a 24-year-old Briton born with Ectrodactyly Ectodermal Dysplasia, is set for her 2025 US Open main draw debut after a strong run through qualifying.

1st round is the final: Lakshya Sen on facing Shi Yuqi in World ChampionshipsIndia's Lakshya Sen will be competing against top-seeded Shi Yuqi in the first round of the BWF World Championships. A confident Lakshya is going into the match hoping to cause a big upset.

The 19-year-old stunned 14th seed Clara Tauson with a thrilling 6-3, 2-6, 7-6 comeback victory.

Ex-South Africa captain makes retirement U-turn, in line for Women's World CupDane van Niekerk has revoked her retirement and returned to international contention, with her name featuring in South Africa's training squad for the upcoming Women's ODI World Cup.

Daniil Medvedev plays victim after US Open outburst: They fine guys like me moreUS Open 2025: Daniil Medvedev said he expected a hefty fine after his extraordinary outburst during Sunday's first-round defeat. The Russian lost his cool before crashing out in the opening round of a Grand Slam for the third successive time this year.

Arsenal learn Bukayo Saka injury timeline ahead of trip to LiverpoolBukayo Saka is set to miss Arsenal's trip to Liverpool on Sunday, as well as England's World Cup qualifiers against Andorra and Serbia next month.

Novak Djokovic to hire Monica Seles as coach? Serb legend opens upNovak Djokovic revealed he is exploring a short-term coaching collaboration with childhood idol Monica Seles, describing it as more emotional than long-term. On court, Djokovic overcame Learner Tien in straight sets to reach the US Open second round.

Fantasy Nightmare: BCCI begins hunt for new sponsor after Dream11 walks outDream11 has ended its title sponsorship of the Indian cricket team following the government's ban on real money gaming. The BCCI is now actively searching for a new sponsor but may not finalise one before the upcoming Asia Cup.

Arshdeep Singh got impatient after not getting chance in England: Punjab coachIndia left-arm seamer Arshdeep Singh was left impatient after not getting a chance in the five-match Test series against England, revealed Punjab bowling coach Gagandeep Singh.

Day 2 Order of Play: Carlos Alcaraz, Venus Williams begin campaignsThe U.S. Open's first round continues on Monday, featuring world number two Carlos Alcaraz taking on a challenging opponent in Reilly Opelka. Former champion Venus Williams makes a highly anticipated return to Grand Slam action in the women's draw, while teenage sensation Victoria Mboko is set to make her Flushing Meadows debut.

Badminton World Championships: Livestream details for India matchesThe Badminton World Championships is set to begin on August 25, Monday. Several top Indian stars are set to participate in the tournament. Here's where you can watch the games live.

Medvedev controversy explained: Photographer sparks insane 10 minutes in US OpenUS Open: Daniil Medvedev riled up the crowd at the Louis Armstrong Stadium on Monday, August 25. Defending the match point in the third set against Benjamin Bonzi, Medvedev sparked an insane 10 minute at the US Open, simply with his on-court antics.

Women's World Cup 2025: Uncapped batter Eyman Fatima named in Pakistan's squadPakistan announced their 15-member squad for the Women's World Cup 2025, featuring uncapped ODI batter Eyman Fatima. The Men in Green will begin their campaign against Bangladesh.

BCCI to end association with sponsor Dream11 after ban on online money gamesThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) and fantasy sports platform Dream11 to end their sponsorship deals following the passage of the Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill, 2025, which imposes a blanket ban on fantasy and real-money gaming platforms.

Shakib Al Hasan becomes first Bangladesh player to reach 500 T20 wicketsVeteran Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan became only the fifth cricketer in history—and the first from his country—to claim 500 wickets in T20 cricket.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
